definitions.definition: a short part of a film that is shown separately

examples.text: Here is a clip from her latest movie.
a clip from a Sherlock Holmes movie
You will see in this clip how well she acts.
The documentary began with a clip from the President's inauguration speech.

definitions.definition: a small metal or plastic object used for holding things together or in place

examples.text: She put a clip in her hair.

definitions.definition: a piece of jewellery that fastens to your clothes
the act of cutting something to make it shorter

examples.text: He gave the hedge a clip.

definitions.definition: a quick hit with your hand

examples.text: She gave him **a clip round the ear** for being cheeky.

definitions.definition: a set of bullets in a metal container that is placed in or attached to a gun for firing

examples.text: Land prices will rise at a healthy clip.

wordOrigin: noun senses 1 to 2 and noun sense 6 Old English clyppan (verb), of West Germanic origin. The noun use dates from the late 15th cent. noun senses 3 to 5 Middle English: from Old Norse klippa, probably imitative.
